intro: Plagiogyria distanta, commonly known as the slender sedge, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to wetland and marshy habitats in North America. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes grass-like plants known as sedges. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring narrow, grass-like leaves and spike-like inflorescences. Its flowers are small and inconspicuous, arranged in dense clusters, and it produces small, three-angled fruits. Plagiogyria distanta plays an important ecological role in stabilizing wetland soils and providing habitat for various invertebrates.
